pronunciation: TRANSGRESS', [Latin transgressus, transgredior; trans and gradior, to pass.]

definitions.text:
Transgress
 [Latin transgressus, transgredior; trans and gradior, to pass.]
1. To pass over or beyond any limit; to surpass.
2. In moral sense, to overpass any rule prescribed as the limit of duty; to break or violate law, civil or moral. To transgress divine law, is sin. Legislators should not transgress laws of their own making.

To offend by violating law; to sin. Chron
2.
